page.title: 07KEMPSEY PRIMARY SCHOOL.
page.content: The school is made up of two different buildings. These are the infant and the junior departments. The infant rooms were built around 1965 and comprise two classrooms and a music room which is also used by the juniors. The junior department was built in 1981. When the junior department opened,it replaced the old school which had been built around 1869. The old school is now the village centre. There are six rooms in the junior department and these are divided among the three 'units' of which 'unit 1' is for the oldest children and 'unit 3' is for the youngest. There is an assembly hall which is also used as a dining room and a gymnasium. There is also a library, an office and staff rooms all of which are used by the whole school.
